name: Azure AD - Create a new user via Azure CLI
description: Creates a new user in Azure AD via the Azure CLI. Upon successful creation, a new user will be created. Adversaries create new users so that their malicious activity does not interrupt the normal functions of the compromised users and can remain undetected for a long time.

data.command:
az login
$userprincipalname = "#{userprincipalname}"
$username = "#{username}"      
$password = "#{password}"
az ad user create --display-name $username --password $password --user-principal-name $userprincipalname
az ad user list --filter "displayname eq 'atomicredteam'"

steps.name: Check dependency 1/3
steps.description: Check if Azure CLI is installed and install manually

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/3
steps.description: Check if Azure CLI is installed and install manually

data.command: echo "use the following to install the Azure CLI manually https://aka.ms/installazurecliwindows"

steps.name: Re-check dependency 1/3
steps.description: Check if Azure CLI is installed and install manually

steps.name: Check dependency 2/3
steps.description: Check if Azure CLI is installed and install via PowerShell

steps.name: Resolve dependency 2/3
steps.description: Check if Azure CLI is installed and install via PowerShell

data.command: echo "use the following to install the Azure CLI $ProgressPreference = 'SilentlyContinue'; Invoke-WebRequest -Uri https://aka.ms/installazurecliwindows -OutFile .\AzureCLI.msi; Start-Process msiexec.exe -Wait -ArgumentList '/I AzureCLI.msi /quiet'; Remove-Item .\AzureCLI.msi"

steps.name: Re-check dependency 2/3
steps.description: Check if Azure CLI is installed and install via PowerShell

steps.name: Check dependency 3/3
steps.description: Update the userprincipalname to meet your requirements

data.command: Update the input arguments so the userprincipalname value is accurate for your environment

steps.name: Resolve dependency 3/3
steps.description: Update the userprincipalname to meet your requirements

data.command: echo "Update the input arguments in the .yaml file so that the userprincipalname value is accurate for your environment"

steps.name: Re-check dependency 3/3
steps.description: Update the userprincipalname to meet your requirements

data.command: Update the input arguments so the userprincipalname value is accurate for your environment

input_arguments.name: username
input_arguments.description: Display name of the new user to be created in Azure AD

input_arguments.name: userprincipalname
input_arguments.description: User principal name (UPN) for the new Azure user being created format email address

input_arguments.name: password
input_arguments.description: Password for the new Azure AD user being created
